name: Partna
headline: Your Global payments partner for Africa
description: Modern companies use Partna's API and B2B payment tools to smoothly launch and operate in Africa

founders.name: Hakeem Adeyemi Orewole, Founder
founders.description: Software engineer who loves turning ideas to reality

founders.name: John Anisere, Founder
founders.description:
I have a background in physics but specialised in  software engineering and eventually co-founded Payourse.
I have spent most my engineering career building products in the crypto space and have also spent some time building products for Hiring, D&I and Community Water Systems.

generated_description:
Partna is a fintech company founded in 2020 that has quickly positioned itself as a global payments partner specifically for the African market. Located in Wilmington, Delaware, and backed by Y Combinator's Winter 2022 batch, Partna offers modern companies an API and B2B payment tools that streamline launching and operating in Africa. 

With a compact team of 16 employees, Partna makes it easy for businesses to collect and payout in local currencies while providing comprehensive support through their API integration. They focus on reducing launch time from months to days with robust, user-friendly documentation and 1-on-1 support, boasting a remarkable 99% transaction success rate.

Their services include:
- A versatile Payments API that allows for seamless currency conversion and user management.
- B2B payments solutions that empower companies to pay vendors and employees in local currencies on demand.

Partna’s commitment to facilitating growth in Africa has garnered positive feedback from customers, highlighting their exceptional technical support and comprehensive service. If you're a modern company looking to navigate the complexities of African payments, Partna can be a strategic partner you might want to consider.

You can learn more about them and explore their offerings by visiting their website [Get Partna](https://getpartna.com). Whether you’re ready to launch or just looking for a demo, they invite interested businesses to reach out and get started.
